alert.note: Alert for Austin; Colorado; Fort Bend; Wharton (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 16 at 8:15AM CDT until May 18 at 7:00AM CDT by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Texas... San Bernard River Near East Bernard affecting Wharton, Austin, Colorado and Fort Bend Counties. San Bernard River near Boling affecting Wharton, Brazoria and Fort Bend Counties. ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Texas... Lavaca River near Edna affecting Jackson County. For the San Bernard River...including East Bernard, Sweeny, Boling... Moderate flooding is forecast. For the Lavaca River...including Edna...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL THURSDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...San Bernard River Near East Bernard. * WHEN...Until Thursday morning. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:00 AM CDT Tuesday the stage was 20.2 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:00 AM CDT Tuesday was 20.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage tomorrow evening and continue falling to 14.5 feet Sunday morning. - Flood stage is 17.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 20.1 feet on 06/06/2019. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (7 am CDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Wed Thu Fri San Bernard River East Bernard 17.0 20.2 Tue 8 am CDT 17.7 16.2 15.5 &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 1000 PM CDT.
